intro: Gnaphalium pterocaulon, commonly known as the woolly cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on the stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Gnaphalium pterocaulon is typically perennial and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides.
